website_summaries.verdict: The quintessential Cuisinart food processor. A reliable powerhouse that won't break your budget. The one to choose if you're looking for a good deal.
pros: The enormous feed tube and straightforward functions make it very practical for most cooks
cons: Heavier than some of the other models

website_summaries.verdict: It has everything you need in a food processor, from power to performance to quality. The best of its kind on the market today.
pros: A powerhouse in the kitchen with its 14-cup work bowl, seven prep functions, and 720-watt motor
Sports a one-touch on and off pulse control
cons: It's quite pricey, but it's a sound investment that will serve many purposes in the kitchen

website_summaries.verdict: A solid Cuisinart product that upholds the company's good name. The best value for your money.
pros: Comes with a variety of user-friendly blades and accessories
cons: Heavier than cheaper models, but for most consumers, it still fits on the countertop

customer_reviews.title: cuisinart does not support this product!
customer_reviews.text: Great when it works, but I haven't been able to use mine in months. The motor doesn't break but the plastic does, and when you ask for a replacement part, you wait forever for the thing to arrive. In my case, when it did arrive, it was the wrong part, and when I asked them to replace the replacement, I got shuttled around from one operator to another. After 5 (that's five) calls over 3+ weeks, the part showed up, but it's the same wrong one they sent me the first time. While all this is going on, you have an expensive machine sitting on your counter that you can't use. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel The Reader

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of dough.
customer_reviews.text: After years of reliable service, I had to replace my KitchenAid food processor because I could not find replacement parts. So I took the recommendation of ATK and bought the Cuisinart 14-cup processor. I use the machine mostly for pizza dough. The Cuisinart just cannot handle the same pizza dough recipe that the KitchenAid breezed through consistently year after year. The Cuisinart's blade comes off during the process. Very disappointed---not only with Cuisinart, but with ATK for their recommendation. I have other Cuisinart products, and they have performed admirably. I would have given this product a zero stars rating had it been possible.
customer_reviews.author: Melvis

customer_reviews.title: This food processor does nothing the ad said it would do.
customer_reviews.text: This machine is deplorably designed. The video attached to the ad says it can handle bread and other stiff doughs. That is false advertising. My first use was today and I tried to make one loaf of bread. The dough went up under the blade, down the cylinder, and all over the base the mixing bowl is locked onto. The machine was hot. It cooked the dough under the blade so that it looked like a noodle and packed so tightly it’s impossible to remove by any method I could think of.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy C.

customer_reviews.title: I don't know how I ever got anything done with my old one.
customer_reviews.text: I just upgraded to this from a cheap (if you call $80 cheap) B&D model. I watched a lot of video reviews on this and they were right on the mark. This unit is top notch. It does everything it's designed to do beautifully. It's so quiet, you can use it while the whole house is asleep without waking a soul. You can whip up dough for two pizzas or a double crust pie without even the tiniest whiff of flour escaping.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie

customer_reviews.title: I
customer_reviews.text: Actually not so pleased. .I wish I had read the 1 star reviews rather than the 4 & 5 star. My favorite roll recipe (yes with 1 egg, room temperature} stalls this processor and the blade comes up in the dough. I have used this favorite recipe for 20 years with 2 other processors and never had this problem. I had planned to send it back, but my husband had thrown the box away. I have been very careful to align the blade and I still have the same mess even though I make a small batch with 3 cups flour HELP!!!!!.
customer_reviews.author: WELL PLEASED

customer_reviews.title: The safety latch on this thing is **TERRIBLE**. It's ...
customer_reviews.text: The safety latch on this thing is **TERRIBLE**. It's so hard to latch that my wife and daughter can't even use if it i'm not home. My wife is reduced to tears every time she tries to use it. IT's worthless, and i'm about ready to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Elvis

customer_reviews.title: I didn't care for this lightweight. It walks around ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't care for this lightweight. It walks around the counter when running. I got spoiled by my older cuisinart food processor which is heavy and dependable. It's a bit smaller, so I wanted to try this larger capacity one. Sent this one back because it seemed a bit "cheesy" compared to the old one and I don't want to stand there and hang on to it while it chops, etc.
customer_reviews.author: magster

customer_reviews.title: America's Test Kitchen recommends this model (DFP-14BCNY) and I have to say I agree with them!
customer_reviews.text: Solid product that works very well. Easy to clean - I just pop everything (except the blades which are quick and easy to hand wash) in my dishwasher and I'm set. Very small gap between the blade and the bowl which makes for a more even dice/chop. Make sure you get the newer model (DFP-14BCNY) with the improved blade. If you get the older model contact Cuisinart for a free replacement. Overall, this is an outstanding product that outperforms others I have used in the past. America's Test Kitchen recommends this model and I have to say I agree with them!
customer_reviews.author: S. Isom

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable Service
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months it stopped working. I knew I was going to get screwed when I had to use a magnifying glass and flashlight to find the serial number. The kid with customer service (LOL) told me I had to pay to have it shipped for repair. He asked where I lived ? Chicago. I figured they had something in the area. He told me to ship it to New Jersey. WTF ? Why bother to ask where I live. I tried to explain it was only 6 mo old. I want a new processor. No. They do not give refunds or replace the unit. This is unacceptable with Amazon and Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: WindyCityGardener

customer_reviews.title: Motor died after about a dozen uses
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on reviews here and ATK. Item did not live up to the hype. After about a 6 uses while processing eggs, the motor began to smoke after less than a minute and quit. Let it cool down and tried it again and the motor died for good. Currently playing the back and forth game with Cuisinart to try and warranty it. We have to ship it back on our dime and hope they warrant it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: the most fragile part has no replacement available
customer_reviews.text: Works great but......... the large pusher assembly that must be engaged for it to work is the most fragile part. The metal slider must engage but that same area is easily dropped and broken. Ok ... I dropped it - my bad. I thought I'll bite the bullet and get a new part. Every part supplier is out of the part and indicates that it has been discontinued. What ? Every other part is available. Be careful handling the cover with the pusher. It slides out very easily. Lesson! Planned obsolescence is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: M. Says

customer_reviews.title: This item failed to lock after a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: The bottom bowl still locks in. But the top does not. It is very temperamental. I looked up trouble-shooting on the web, and saw that this is a major problem with this machine. When you call the company tech support, they want to sell you a new bowl and top for $40.
customer_reviews.author: Segal

customer_reviews.title: Defective!
customer_reviews.text: I use it once to chop almonds and then make almond paste. It chopped the nuts and then lost power and would barely stir water. Returning it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: They don’t make them like they used to! We had our first Cuisinart for 37 years before the shaft cracked, so we happily purchased our second one. We are so disappointed that the shaft broke on our new model in less than one year and we haven’t had a response on this problem. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne H

customer_reviews.title: This machine is discontinued and has been for quite a while
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on May 15, 2019. I used it once on May 22, 2019 grinding apples and cooked green beans for dog food. I tried to use it on May 29 (more dog food) and it would not work. Turned out if I twisted the cover sideways and inserted a knife blade into the base it would work. WHAT? I called Cuisinart and they told me that model was discontinued and had been for quite a while. She is sending me a courtesy cover. Next stop - Amazon customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Goes together differently than my old one.
customer_reviews.text: I am so sorry that I gave away my original Cuisinart food processor. It was circa 1980 's and it was so simple to use and so lightweight. It took me forever to figure this new one out. It goes together differently than the original. I finally watched a you tube video on how to put it together and saw how it had changed. The whole set up is backwards now. That is all I can say. It worked fine once I figured it out but I could not have done it without the you tube video. The instructions in the book were non existent.
customer_reviews.author: Book-A-Holic

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart Processors quality is NOT what it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: I NO LONGER RECOMMEND BUYING CUINART FOOD PROCESSOR – BUY ANOTHER BRAND, Cuisinart does not make food processors like they used to. Had my first Cuisinart food processor for over 25 years. It worked wonderfully until the time motor stopped. Being very pleased with it’s performance I bought a new one. It stopped working one month after the warranty expired. I bought a new one, 2 months after purchasing Cuisinart DFP-14BCNY 14-Cup. The stem cracked after grating cheese. I called warranty department and spoke to Frank the floor manager (employee #050) he said unit can not be replaced, I only repaired. The repair will take between 4-6 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Maria simon

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart DFP-14BCNY 14-Cup
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Cuisinart DFP-14BCNY 14-Cup in May of this year as a gift. They returned the gift to me about a month ago telling me they could never get it to work. I have been trying and nothing! It appears when you put the top on it won't push down on that little button in the back telling the unit its top is on? Please advise .. little to pricey to just trash it. I have had my own Cuisinart for more than 30 years and love it. Can maybe you replace the top and let see if that works??
customer_reviews.author: Sandra O.

customer_reviews.title: The bowl broke within a few months of purchase
customer_reviews.text: Our old Cuisinart finally broke after sixteen years of continuous use. We purchased a new one, and started having trouble within a few months. The spring on the bowl stopped functioning, but we thought the problem was with the lid and ordered a new one. Figured out that it wasn't the lid--but the bowl. My spouse figured out how to get the thing to run by pushing the spring down with a knife (a feat I could not quite master)...A replacement work bowl costs around $70, which we will have to order, but with a lot of grumbling.
customer_reviews.author: N.K.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Christmas and the mechanism in the lid is supposed to push down a button on the motor that allows the motor to spin the blace. Well the mechanism was broken..I had the thing returned, AMAZON was great and made it easy sent out a replacement fast, no problem there. Well with this 2nd one the motor did not work AND the mechanism was broken on this one as well. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Sandy Hook, CT

customer_reviews.title: I give up, after 2 of these utterly failed
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't a problem with the motor (there's a way to test that). It's some sort of problem with the plastic container not pushing down the safety mechanism to make things work. NOTICE how the stainless steel/ silver is cheaper than the other colors? I think perhaps it's the silver ones that have this problem. The other colors might be fine, but I'm not taking the chance (nor spending an extra hundred $$$). I'd really like to find out the story behind this!
customer_reviews.author: M. Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Defective, do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Cuisinart food processor for 25 years - worked great, then died. The old one was high quality. This model has a motor problem: first one I ordered didn't work, returned it, second one same thing. The instructions are non-existent, but I put it together correctly because I know the product. Called Cuisinart upon receiving second defective item. Tested motor by pressing button on top of platform and depressing levers. Dead. Dead. Dead. The phone attendant told me that this model had been discontinued due to 'motor problems'. No kidding! DON'T BUY THIS. My opinion: go to a different company. For Cuisinart and Amazon to sell these is unethical. They know there's a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overheated and misrepresented warranty
customer_reviews.text: Normally I've been pleased with the quality of Cuisinart products, but this time the food processor overheated within two weeks of our using it. When we called the service department about honoring the warranty, they told us to mail the product in at our expense and to wait to hear whether we would have to pay for the repairs. That policy may honor the warranty from a legal standpoint, but it puts the risk on the customer to pursue a repair or replacement. We used the food processor for our small food business, so it wasn't worth the time or expense to pursue a repair.
customer_reviews.author: Chicory Market

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, QUIET, AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: So far, this Cuisinart food processor has surpassed my expectations. My husband and I spent 2 weeks researching food processors and finally settled on this one. There are many pros, but also a few cons. Pros: -Very quiet -Powerful -Easy cleanup -Sharp blades -Large bowl -Heavy (sturdy) Cons: -The sliver is one size fits all which is not good. -Hard to put together sometimes -Limited settings Overall the cons do not take away from this machine very much. I'm very happy with it. It makes excellent fresh salsa and guacamole, but also can handle doughs too.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Cupples

customer_reviews.title: NOT a great buy
customer_reviews.text: Would have bought the Breville had I known the small size of the opening into this appliance. My old Cuisinart processor had 2 optional openings.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Terrible experience with a defective product and useless customer service - Lowest rating possible!
customer_reviews.text: We Ordered this to replace our Kitchen Aid that had faithfully worked for 11 years, but this was defective right out of the box. Of course, it arrived useless for a holiday week when we had lots of family in town. I immediately called Cuisinart. After almost 30 minutes wait I finally talked to a rep. I explained the problem and the urgency getting a working lid, but was told everything was shut down for another week before a replacement could be processed. Obviously I will never consider another Cuisinart product. There are more favorable options with better customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Guy

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT - PURE JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product as a Christmas present for my wife. When she tried to use it for the first time, it would not turn on. Tried to contact Quisinart's customer hotline with the problem and received no response, either by email or phone. Sadly, Quisinart does not make the quality products they were once noted for, and their "customer service" is poor. Finally I returned the product to Amazon and am very pleased with the way Amazon handled the return.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Delicate flower
customer_reviews.text: The worst, most frustrating experience I’ve ever had with an appliance. It is too difficult to use. I used it twice before I had to replace the top. The alignment of parts is unforgiving and easily leads to breakage. After purchasing the new top, it broke on first use. I repaired but then the bottom wouldn’t line up right to turn the unit on and it broke. Save your money and some aggravation and look elsewhere. This delicate flower does not belong in an active kitchen. My Ham Beach lasted 20+ years and I never had a problem. I bought this on Cooks Illustrated recommendation, but it is too delicate. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: forest farmer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: How did I ever live without this machine? The thing is a MONSTER, extra heavy motor and I have no doubt I could use it for a wood chipper! Make pie crust or hamburger in a NY minuet, without any fuss. It's a little difficult to clean....everything has to come apart, but still the product it produces is exceptional. ALSO, I've discovered not to bump into the blade when putting it back on the shelf. That chopping blade is SHARP and cut's through skin before you know it. It's a strange sort of grind on the blade, serrated and curved at the same time. SHARP to the touch. It was costly, but still....I'm really happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Gross

customer_reviews.title: Why you need a 14-Cup Food Processor
customer_reviews.text: I mostly cook for 1, but this is still a great food processor for 3 reasons: 1. Size: Any food processor can only process food that fills about 1/3 of the bowl. So this 14 cup food processor can comfortably work with about 5 cups of food. If I had a 3 or 6 cup food processor I would need to run multiple batches. 2. Dishwasher safe: You can put everything except for the base (the part with the motor) in the dishwasher. 3. Power: Most food processors on Amazon are about 350 watts. This is a little over 700. That means it is powerful enough to knead 3-4 cups of sticky pizza dough in about 2-3 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Frequentflyer2k

customer_reviews.title: Bad motor
customer_reviews.text: I opened the Cuisinart DFP-14BCNY 14-Cup Food Processor, after 2 months of purchase, to discover that the motor didn't work at all. I tried to make it work but could not. I went back to amazon for a return of the product but the return time window had past. What a waste money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor design causes safety issue
customer_reviews.text: I have many Cuisinart products and this is my second food processor. After 2 years, the metal stick on the pusher for the feed tube has broken off and is now a safety hazard. I have to insert the metal stick to engage the safety latch but now the machine will operate without the food pusher in place. When requesting a replacement, my warranty was void because I use the machine in my bed & breakfast though I would consider the use to be normal wear and tear. Very disappointed in the customer service as this seems like a design flaw since only a small piece of plastic is anchoring the metal stick.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart persists in making a hard to clean processor. Some food, like dough, gets inside between the blade and the motor shaft, hardens there, and is a chore to remove. Evidently the designers are not home cooks who want to enjoy using their machine, not simply looking at it. A handle on the bowl would also be very helpful in the cleaning process.
customer_reviews.author: H. S. Gersten

customer_reviews.title: Mother of a food processor!
customer_reviews.text: Although this machine is taller and heavier than I'd like, it is much quieter than my previous Cuisinart. Fully assembled, it will not fit under my upper cabinets, which is a disappointment. But on the positive side, the bowl capacity is great. The motor is powerful which is probably why the machine is heavier than my previous model. I like the fact that the components (except the base of course) are all dishwasher safe. I purchased this model on the recommendation of America's Test Kitchen which had put the machine through more chopping, shredding, and abuse than I ever will.
customer_reviews.author: TJay

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: I love my Cuisinart, but I would be frustrated without all the attachments that I have acquired over the years. I recommend two work bowls (I have five), and a selection of blades for lettuce, cheese, fruits, and vegetables. And I think the large mouth chute isn't as important as the funnel. That funnel is my friend. Can't speak enough about this product. I inherited my mother's and it finally gave out after 20+ years of service. In all fairness, I do use my #itamix in final preparation when I need a super fine texture.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Corti

customer_reviews.title: Ganache by gosh
customer_reviews.text: I've been dragged kicking and screaming into the 21st Century. I wanted to make some ganache frosting for some cupcakes and the recipe called for a food processor, so I decided to use a big knife to chop and my blender to finish it. I couldn't find my blender and had 3 days to make the cupcakes before the charity holiday party. So I got one on Amazon, it was delivered in 2 days, made the cupcakes and got them to the party on time. I've been contemplating getting a food processor for some time. I think I picked a winner. I really like this Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Mary

customer_reviews.title: We regularly use it a few times a week and it works great. It's single speed and at first I thought ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed and just does-the-job! We regularly use it a few times a week and it works great. It's single speed and at first I thought that would be a problem but it's not. You don't need more than one speed. The blade attachment is all we use and it's great. Easy to clean too. The red and stainless looks awesome too. :-) If you're an experienced cook looking for a food processor without any frills that just works, this is your baby. Buy her and you'll smile every time you glance across the kitchen and see this red beauty.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: After 3 uses, the on/off switch sticks on.
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews and comparing other machines we felt this one was the right choice...... Wrong ! The on/off switch sticks on. After tapping the switch multiple times, the unit eventually shuts off. This failure appeared after 3 uses.. The other item I need to mention is that in a world of crazy safety precautions... this unit is over the top regarding assembly and safety items so it cant be operated with the unit not being fully assembled. Its tricky to get everything just so, Cleaning isnt easy, but I understand that with the blades and ALL THE PIECES NEEDED TO MAKE THIS UNIT RUN, is the real problem that makes cleaning it a chore.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy B.

customer_reviews.title: Beware - my food processor broke in less than two years!
customer_reviews.text: This model worked well for chopping and grating Parmesan, but I have had difficulty getting the cover secured. The feed tube is on the back instead of the front as my previous Cuisinart model had it and I found that awkward. Yesterday, I could not get it to lock, so therefore it no longer works. My son in law checked it out and confirmed it was kaput because the locking mechanism in the base got out of alignment somehow. I bought it in July 2018! I will be selecting a different brand after two disappointing Cuisinart models.
customer_reviews.author: M. Levine

customer_reviews.title: Either I got a lemon or this machine is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box and have used this machine twice and each time it was a nightmare. After reading the instruction manual closely, I tried using the machine. The bowl was impossible to take on and off, and the top doesn't seem to want to fit. The locking mechanism seems to get stuck, either completely on or off. Once, after finally managing to process some dough, I tried taking the bowl off and it was stuck... the machine still turned on with the top off! Talk about dangerous! Maybe I got a lemon. I've contacted customer support to see if I can get a replacement or a refund. I had high hopes for such a pricey food processor.
customer_reviews.author: CChang

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't have the power of the older model.
customer_reviews.text: My family has always brought Cuisinart products but I must say this food processor isn't near the Guisinart standard as our last food processor. It doesn't have the power of the older model. Buyers should consider another model and maybe it will be better than this model.
customer_reviews.author: THESWAN

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this for 16 months and used i approx 20 times. Tried to use it and the spring device ceased so i tried to wiggle the spring device to get the base to connect with the base to set it so i could put the blade and top on. Did the job, removed the smoked salmon dip, but the main base would not release from the unit. Ill through this away and will buy a new brand
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Choice
customer_reviews.text: Not well made at all, flimsy, and no power to chop or mince vegetables. I made a very poor decision on this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be carfull of Fake Reviews
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic safety mechanisms on the bowel dose not engage. Machine dose no work the second day. How possibly the reviews are so high? My advice to customer: Do not trust review anymore. Many of them are fake.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Baruch

customer_reviews.title: Plastic lid is cheap and breaks frequently
customer_reviews.text: The plastic top has tabs which make the safety system work. The tabs are flimsy and break. Every year I replace it. I'm close to sending this junk to my local thrift shop.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. K. NYC

customer_reviews.title: French fries disc
customer_reviews.text: French fries disc does not work, it detaches from the stem and everything goes crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Janele

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. I actually use it daily. 1. It is durable 2. Cleans easily 3. You can process almost anything 4. I've made liquidy sauces with it. You have to move quick but liquid won't leak out even if it's over filled unless you leave it in there an unreasonable amount of time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy I purchased this!
customer_reviews.text: I had a very small food processor I used for small items, but with a family of four I needed to pull the trigger and purchase something bigger. Added, I wanted something to mix pizza dough. This Cuisinart fits all the things I need. It slices beautifully, chops, blends, and mixes with ease, and it is been awesome with dough. Cleanup is easy, and everything stores away within the container. And it looks fantastic. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hap

customer_reviews.title: Great for chopping terrible when using attachments.
customer_reviews.text: For dicing and chopping the blades and power of the machine work great. However, if you want to shred, don't even try to use it. A fault in the design makes so food gets stuck in between the lid and shredding attachment. For this price, I think Cuisinart should have designed a much better system...
customer_reviews.author: Joaquim

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of crap. I thought I was upgrading but no, it's horrible, not user friendly, and I want my old one back.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn S.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but heavy
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a 7 cup Kitchenaid processor when it started to be used more often. The 14 cup work bowl looks deceptively small at first when comparing them side by side. It managers to double the capacity without being too large. The base is heavy. Very heavy. It's solidly built and throws a lot more power at the blade while being very quiet. The first time it was used I was actually concerned by how quiet it was, but the results ended up being much better than any other processors I've used. This is excellent quality for the money and probably the best device you'll use without getting into more professional variants.
customer_reviews.author: Jason T. Lease

customer_reviews.title: How disappointing! I ordered this for Christmas and it's been used and missing parts!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my daughter for Christmas. She opened it this morning and when she went to use it, there was food on it and it's missing both of the pushers and it won't even turn on!!!
customer_reviews.author: Disappointed Mom

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart 14 cup
customer_reviews.text: This machine is no where near the cuisinart that it is replacing. It is lighter in weight, and just does not meet the same standards as the other one. My old one is over 25 and was the same size as the new. It was made in Japan rather than China. I had a lot of extra accessories which don't quite fit the new which is a shame. I bought it because Americas test kitchen had rated it high. Not so wonderful after all. Which I had purchased a different brand now.
customer_reviews.author: deide

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Barely used it, the blade got stuck to the shaft and would not come out no matter what we tried! For that price you would expect better customer service but we have been left high and dry :( Disappointing Otherwise a good food processor overall but what use it it stops working.
customer_reviews.author: dalfeen

customer_reviews.title: A superior food processor
customer_reviews.text: I have a small kitchen and storage ‘real estate’ is a problem. My old KitchenAid food processor took up the space of the device, plus the same space requirement for the box with all the extra blades. This processor is only the device, plus two cutting discs, which easily fits behind it. The Cuisinart Food Processor is also MUCH easier to clean. There is a reason many cooking shows use this processor — it’s good, powerful, easy to clean and does not take up much room.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough about the ease of use and blending power! We bought this based on a Cooks Illustrated recommendation and we couldn't be happier. There was a defect with the first one we received, and we had a replacement in just a couple of days. Chopping veggies, grating cheese, slicing potatoes, it's all a breeze. Such an upgrade from our old model!
customer_reviews.author: Sailsgirl

customer_reviews.title: My 1st Food Processor
customer_reviews.text: I have used this a few times, and promptly moved located it on my kitchen counter where it will be easy to access and use. The only thing close to this that I had used before was a Ninja chopper. I found the Cuisinart easy to use. I had a little difficulty at first getting everything lined up correctly so it would function as I dumped ingredients out, but I got past that pretty quickly. I had no trouble dicing different vegetables, and it was easy to clean. So far, I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D37

customer_reviews.title: ... after reading many many reviews and couldn't be more disappointed. The size is terribly small and it takes ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading many many reviews and couldn't be more disappointed. The size is terribly small and it takes a long time for a lot of intervention to get anything chopped. I used my previous one all the time now I hate getting this thing out. Worst food processor I have ever used!
customer_reviews.author: Lynelle Allan

customer_reviews.title: I only had this a few months and it broke.
customer_reviews.text: I do not like this food processor at all. I had a Kitchen Aide for 25 years and had no problems with it. This one broke after I used it for only a few months. I hope they give me my money back so I can buy a better one. The plastic is so cheap that it cracked and the top won't fit on properly. Also, this does NOT hold 14 cups as advertised. It is an 11 cup processor. IT was misrepresented.
customer_reviews.author: Luv2Read

customer_reviews.title: Practically restaurant quality!
customer_reviews.text: I use to spend HOURS cutting up veggies to freeze or make salads with, but now finish in record time. I got the extra blades and holders to go with it and consider it all money well spent. Best part is it all goes in the dishwasher - except the base of course. Very well constructed if heavy. I store it on a piece of thin cardboard as it sticks to whatever smooth surface you place it on - that way I can slide it out from it's storage place.
customer_reviews.author: Olyve Oyl

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: After my Braun food processor of 20 of faithful service died, I turned to America's Test Kitchen for a recommendation. They highly recommended this one. One of the main things I use a food processor for is making mayonnaise. I've been doing it for years. I followed the instructions exactly and it was an epic fail. I ended up with soup. I tried to find the "How to" videos online to no avail. I'll be returning this product and buying a new Braun
customer_reviews.author: Dana davis

customer_reviews.title: Loving my new cooking assistant
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my Cuisinart 14-cup food processor. Until now, I have always cut everything by hand. I have made several vegetable based and minestrone soups since receiving it, and prepping ingredients is actually fun now. It takes a little practice to get the hang of the chopping blade and gauging which slicing blade to use. I currently have the chopping/mixing blade, 2mm, 6mm 8mm blades & shredder. I probably use the 2mm most often. I also purchased 2 of the disc holders, and I am pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: Sher'rie

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart DFP-14BCNY 14-Cup Food Processor, Brushed Stainless Steel - Silver
customer_reviews.text: Got my wife one of these over 10 years ago, the slightly smaller 10 cup version. It finally broke after 10 years so I got her this model. OMG she loves the bigger size! We all use it, one of the most useful kitchen appliances we have (next to our coffee machine). We all highly recommend the Cuisnart brand 14 cup Food Processor.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Monster food processor
customer_reviews.text: This is a real machine of a food processor. Giant high-torque electric motor. The best part of all? Two buttons. ON. and OFF. No odd 10 button array of gimicky suggestive uses like 'crush ice' or 'shred abs'. This machine exposes all the little cheap toys posing as food processors that you can buy at your local ___-mart for the little frauds that they are. I would definitely buy this machine again. But likely I never will have to.
customer_reviews.author: Pynch

customer_reviews.title: What a great kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: We keep looking for recipes so we can use this food processor. I admit that I am a die hard cut and chop by hand person, but I made some "raw lasagne" (no noodles, all vegetables & nuts) and this tool did the best job ever for all the chopping, blending, and grinding I needed to do. I did ask around to my friends and family members and they all suggested the Cuisinart. I am glad they did.
customer_reviews.author: CKL

customer_reviews.title: Lid of Cuisinart warped. It’s extremely had to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Lid of Cuisinart warped. It’s extremely had to get lid on or off.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Haass-hall

customer_reviews.title: Parts missing and Lid Lock not work
customer_reviews.text: Lid did not fit on so lock would not work so processed would not process. In addition, parts were missing - the slicing and grating disks and attachment so they can actually be used! Also, when returned, the refund went to a GIFT card when I needed it back in my Bank!
customer_reviews.author: 10BirdGirl

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if dishwasher safe...
customer_reviews.text: The thing works fine, but I started having a problem with the parts fitting together after my first time through the dishwasher. The box says it's dishwasher safe, but this is when the problem started. The parts no longer sit flush together and you kind of have to jam it together for it to work. Not sure if this is just the way it is, but it's quite uncomfortable to have to do this every time. My old food processors have not had this type of issue with fitting during over 10 years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Callum

customer_reviews.title: but this one seems to be quite a bit better at chopping and mixing right in the processor
customer_reviews.text: I had a smaller one that was OKay, but this one seems to be quite a bit better at chopping and mixing right in the processor, things like graham cracker crusts etc. much easier. There WAS a bit of a learning curve putting it all together since the first one I received didn't work and I finally called service support to make sure I had it together correctly ( I didn't but it still wasn't working and i had to send it back) The replacement I received though is working great and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Stacey

customer_reviews.title: ) Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: It was between buying a KitchenAid mixer or this. While I could get the attachments to make the KitchenAid do everything the Cuisinart 14-cup processor does, the cost would have been monumental. Can you whip up some egg whites with this? probably not. But for the bulk of my cooking and mixing, this appliance does it all. I used to have a small Cuisinart, that had a chute for grating cheese. Wish it had that. But I guess with the 14-cup bowl, they figure you don't need a chute for grating cheese. (You really need more than 14 cups of grated cheese?) Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mauigir1

customer_reviews.title: serious machine
customer_reviews.text: This review is after only one recipe, a meatball/vegetable stew, but I feel confident in the five stars already. This machine is way heavier than I expected and it is not even a die cast model. Very powerful, quiet, and starts/stops very quickly. As shown on ATK, the blades are close to the sides and bottom. This recipe had three uses and I didn't scape down the sides at all. If for no other reason, I would buy this one because the bowl is smooth with no creases. It took seconds to wash it out. Which is major because I will not put any processor pieces into a dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Could not turn on
customer_reviews.text: I could not get the this processor to be operational. Where the back, middle of the bowl snaps into place to depress the spring couldn't even come close to engaging to start the motor. I called Cuisinart and they are going to send a new bowl. Not sure when it will arrive. This is my third Cuisinart food processor so I would expect to update my review with much more favorable results
customer_reviews.author: davwal

customer_reviews.title: Lid latch broke again.
customer_reviews.text: My previous Cuisinart plastic deal that is supposed to latch when the lid closes does not push down enough to engage the motor. Just purchased a new one and got to use it for one day. Again, that plastic deal on the lid does not push the rod down far enough to engage the motor. I am in the middle of canning season and not very happy right now. Need to contact Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: skidsteer guy

customer_reviews.title: The bowl sticks on the base, it broke trying to get it off the machine to empty the food.
customer_reviews.text: Very overrated by America's Test Kitchen. After about a week the bowl started sticking on the base such that I eventually broke the bottom of the handle trying to whack it to the left to release so I could remove it and get at my food. The main processing "sharp" serrated blade dulled very quickly. The harshest thing I used it on was almonds that I had pre smashed a bit. I used the grating attachment on refrigerated hard cheeses like extra sharp cheddar, it leaves quite a bit ungrated.
customer_reviews.author: SeaCorey

customer_reviews.title: A great replacement.
customer_reviews.text: When I bought my last one (44) years ago it was called the professional model. I used my old one to make ginger scones this a.m. The new one is no longer professional, it is just a 14 C. food processor. Can't wait for it to arrive. If it is basically the same as the old one, I will buy new plastic (the bucket is deteriorating) and give the old one to my brother. The base is still great. The new one arrived. They are almost the same. The plastic bucket ant attachments do not quite feel a rugged as the old ones, but they probably would rather you preplaced it more often than every 40 years )))
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth H. Sayers

customer_reviews.title: Works great, wife loves it, smooth operation
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used over 1 month now for various preparations & my wife loves this. Plenty of power & cuts wonderfully. The only criticism so far is that some pieces (very few) of like carrots or cabbage fall to the bottom under the blade & don’t get fully shredded & you may end up with 1 or 2 or so bigger pieces than you prefer. Not a big deal tho. Very smooth operation & simple switches to push to operate. So far, we are glad we purchased & have had no issues & recommend it for a very nice food processor for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Rankin

customer_reviews.title: Love It! Great Capacity
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 20 year old model that is still going strong. I needed the larger capacity as my family has grown. The operation of these is very basic, which is what I like. You don’t need the owners manual to figure it out. I like that the blades go to the edge. Super sturdy, love the suction on the bottom. Gave my 20 year old one to my nephew where he will probably get another 20 years of use from.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pwerful and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I got the Cuisenart to replace an old Osterizer. It works like a charm to make large amounts of hummus. I used it to grate potatoes for latkes and it worked so quickly the potatoes didn't turn color. My husband said they were just like his moms. It is very quiet and easy to use. It's a little tricky to assemble, but once you see how it is put together then it's easy. For safety purposes, everything must be lined up just right to put the plunger in. The video helped a lot.
customer_reviews.author: melzy

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Workhorse product. Cuisinart quality, lots of power, easy to clean, solid and heavy. They fixed th blade problem, and this one comes with the new design blade, so no worries there. Only thing missing is a blade storage fixture, which would be so easy to include - but they charge extra for that! This thing slices potatoes or carrots like magic, makes pesto like nobody's business. Buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like everything about this except I never get nicely diced ...
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this except I never get nicely diced vegetables. My tomatoes and onions become a mush instead of the desired diced look. Apart from this, the slicer, shredder is beautiful. I make naan at home everyday, and use this to knead the dough.
customer_reviews.author: sehresh

customer_reviews.title: Looks good. Works perfectly. Well made.
customer_reviews.text: After 48 years, it was time to replace the food processor my wife and I received as a wedding present. This is powerful. Works quickly. Once you get the hang of how to align the parts, you’ll love it. It’s heavy and the power cord is short. (BTW, my nostalgic wife kept the original. It’s in the garage.)
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled to receive as a gift
customer_reviews.text: Really gets the chopping done amazingly quickly. I've never had another food processor, and not having one pushed me to develop pretty solid knife skills. Still, sometimes, there is way too much chopping to do to keep up with the rest of life. So I was thrilled to receive this as a gift. That said, I totally realize that a mandolin is sold for the purpose of nice, even slices; but I do wish that a food processor had the means to produce more even slices than this food processor produced. Other than that one issue which I'd love to see addressed in my version of Utopia, I do love having this food processor.
customer_reviews.author: E. Nessman

customer_reviews.title: Our 2nd one to purchase.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this unit 3 years ago and use it often. However, the work bowl and lid had gotten some cracks so it was difficult to get the system to engage the safety features. So, we bought another unit on sale at Amazon to replace the parts that were affected. Now we have a new power unit in storage for future. The cost of replacing the bowl, lid, and such was higher than buying a whole new package. The machine works great on all sorts of projects we use it for. Am happy over all with this model and it is nice to have the 14C capacity for larger jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Hesitant to use name

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart always makes a great product and this one is no different. Easy to use, sturdy and powerful, it will meet most of your needs. The one drawback is that the full line for liquids is not even halfway up, because of the design. So if you need to blend some canned tomatoes or whiz up some soup to make it smoother, you need to do it only a few cups at a time, otherwise the liquid leaks out through the center spindle and out the bottom. Messy!
customer_reviews.author: Quentin E. Hodgson

customer_reviews.title: Lesson learned
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had problems with this since day one. Mostly the problem has been closing it. I needed it desperately so I was glad when it came a couple of days earlier but for me to return it and wait for a new one seemed not worth it at the time. Boy am I regretting that decision now!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Years ago I thought I'd save money and purchase a Kitchen Aid food processor. Well, five years later I realized that was a mistake. I never cared for the look and functionality of the Kitchen Aid and then one day I went to puree soup and it just didn't work. What a mess! You can't go wrong with Cuisinart's food processors, they're the best. Clean up is easy, just wash and lay out to dry. The look is nice, it's more compact and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dani M

customer_reviews.title: feed chute is too short
customer_reviews.text: The actual processor is great. My problem with it is that the feed chute is too small/short.I checked out all processors for the best one for grating blocks of cheese. Problem with this is, you have to cut the block into small cubes to feed into the chute. If the chute was taller, you could just feed it in, instead of having to do all the extra cutting.
customer_reviews.author: patti

customer_reviews.title: Careful of chopping veggies.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to chop up veggies for ceviche. You have to be careful or they get blended into mush, or if not enough you end up with chunks. After each blend (chop) we'd put the contents into a separate bowl, but there were zero chunks. The hand soap choppers are have more control as do the knife. But otherwise, the powers there, easy to clean. No extra food in the hopper to dig out. Slicing is a breeze. Looking forward to making dough with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri K

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived Defective
customer_reviews.text: Contacted Cusinart spoke with tech support they assisted me and after several attempts the unit failed. Tech said problem with the bowl as we tested the power of the base which was fine. I ordered a replacement it arrived today Jan 25, 2020 and it was also defective. Since I spoke with the Tech a few days ago I knew how to check all the parts. This time the base didn't have any power when I stuck a pen in the circle at the back of the unit. I am discouraged and will be purchasing a Breville food processor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The processor doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the processor was ordered in November, 2019. I placed it in my cupboard to be used at a later date. In July of 2020, I took it out to use. It was absolutely dead. Nothing. I had an old Cuisinart for years, so I know how to put it together! Don't make my mistake. Buy from a store that you can return it to and not from Amazon. Try it out right away! Of course I no longer have the box, but to whom would I return it? $106.99 down the drain. Just a friendly warning. I never in a million years thought it wouldn't work! It looks beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce A Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much up to Cuisinart's usual reputation
customer_reviews.text: This food processor seems fairly durable like the old Cuisinart's year ago. You do have to get used to how to correctly place the work bowl in place; then the large feed tube (seems like it's actually placed in the backward position) and finally the small feed tube. Once done processing, you have to remove the parts in the reverse order of how you assemble it for use. It processes food well and seems very powerful. I would think this will last for years to come. I do recommend this product. I would give it 5 stars if it were quicker to put into use each time.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Cole

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: It works quite well, but I do have some minor complaints. I don't know what possessed them to put the feed chute on the back side. Also it requires too much force to insert the large food pusher due to the safety interlock. This unit replaced an older model KitchenAid which I liked a little better. But KitchenAid has completely changed their designs since then, and this Cuisinart is much better than the newer KitchenAids.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Campbell

customer_reviews.title: food processor
customer_reviews.text: Excited about the design and strength capabilities. I did have trouble getting it to start. Returned and received another immediately. Excellent Factory, excellent problem solving
customer_reviews.author: diane.nola

customer_reviews.title: Power and simplicity combined
customer_reviews.text: This processor has the power to get any job done, short of chopping rock. It is also simple to use with no decisions about which power setting to use, plus it’s easy to clean. I use mine for everything between chopping cabbage for coleslaw to slicing celery, onions, apples, etc. to making pie pastry.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: Love my machine. It works for everything really. Only improvement I would like to see is a locking mechanism for the blade since it can lift. Each day I throw frozen strawberries or blueberries, a little low fat milk and some vanilla to make a fruit whip. The sugar is quite low with these berries and it's a guilt free dessert. Sometimes I add dark shaved chocolate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A really nice processor for the price
customer_reviews.text: This puppy is the best-cheapest. It has plenty of muscle to get the job done and plenty of capacity. I make peanut butter and date bars in it on a regular basis and it makes short work of slicing veggies. She seems like a big girl but I honestly only need a food processor for the big jobs. If you're going to get one, I wouldn't go cheaper or smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Wagner

customer_reviews.title: A happy replacement
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was made as a replacement for an earlier Cuisinart purchase from years ago. My concern was that accessory blades wouldn't fit the new food processor. Thankfully everything fit and replacements were unnecessary. The food processor works like a charm, blends..chops..shreds..kneads..and most everything else for which a food processor would be needed. Easy assembly, easy disassembly and dishwasher safe bowl, lid and blades. I'm very, no, EXTREMELY happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: wrj, Owings Mills, MD   This is an addendum to an earlier review of my recent purchase of the All-Clad stainless steel kettle.  I've noticed there are several negative comments about this kettle, such as white flecks in the water, to a filmy discoloration on the interior of the kettle.  After daily use, my interior is as shiny as when I first bought it.  One thing though, I use bottled water.  I find that I don't get like scale on my pots, this kettle, my clothes iron or my drip coffeemaker.  I'm thinking that the reported white flecks in poured water could be that scale flaking off the inside surface. Distilled white vinegar can help eliminate limescale buildup.  As for residue on the outside, I remove my kettle from the stove before frying/sauteeing to avoid free radicals from settling on my kettle. Just a thought.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This blender is a dream come true for me. This is one great product.
customer_reviews.author: Sunking

customer_reviews.title: Great Food Processor!
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for a previous 14 cup Cuisinart Food Processor purchased 10-15 years ago. My previous unit was great except the bowl had a chipped off portion due to it falling on the floor and because of the that, the unit wasn't sealing properly. We had to hold the top on securely the whole time so it would run. This new unit is fantastic! Powerful motor, new sharp blade, nice snug fit of all parts. Works like a dream! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: hlit4

customer_reviews.title: This item appeared to be used.
customer_reviews.text: The food processor wouldn't work. This is my 4th or 5th Cuisinart - I know how they work. Everything locked in place and motor made noise but wouldn't process. Turning the base over to see if we missed something - it was filthy and had food or something else in the bottom and it appeared two of the 'feet' were worn. SUPER DISAPPOINTED and no banana bread.
customer_reviews.author: jane kanan

product_meta.title: Cuisinart DFP-14BCNY 14-Cup Food Processor, Brushed Stainless Steel - Silver
product_meta.description: Color:Silver| Pattern Name:Food ProcessorThe Cuisinart DFP-14BCNY custom food Processor has an extra-large Feed tube that holds whole fruits and vegetables. Features a 14-Cup work bowl, 4mm stainless steel Medium slicing disc, stainless steel shredding disc, and chopping/mixing blade. Includes a spatula and recipe book.
feature_bullets: Includes stainless steel Standard slicing disc (4mm), medium shredding disc and stainless steel chopping/mixing blade. Cord length : 36 Inches
720-Watt large-capacity food processor with intuitive "on" And "off/pulse" Buttons
14-Cup Lexan work bowl; extra-large Feed tube; small and large pushers
Note: shredding and slicing blades are not adjustable.
Refer to the user manual to ensure proper set-up and features of the unit prior to use.
Stainless Steel Standard Slicing Disc (4mm) and Medium Shredding Disc

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,062 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
